cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi Texas
cyclone.trajectory: slowly drifting west, then turning northwest and approaching the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda/Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible if Beta reaches minimal hurricane strength before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in Matagorda and San Antonio Bays, including Calhoun Port Authority waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches, producing flash and urban flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and prolonged coastal flooding due to Beta’s slow motion.
